From voiceover creation to analytics, generative artificial intelligence has the potential to streamline and enhance many aspects of the video production process! AI's impact on video production will grow even more significant as it continues to develop and evolve. However, like most good things, using AI in your video production process also has limitations. In particular, AI has shortcomings in areas that require a more insightful and creative approach. In this blog post, we'll explore the benefits and drawbacks of using AI in video production and discuss where it works best in the overall video production process. Revolutionizing Video Production: How AI Is Changing The Future Artificial Intelligence is likely the future of video production. The expanding use of AI models in video production has been revolutionizing video marketing and the whole video production industry. With AI technology, it's possible to streamline your workflow, improve accuracy, and reduce project turnaround times. Thanks to this powerful tool, your production team can spend more time focusing on creativity and innovation. This extra focus will help ensure unique and captivating videos. Here are some specific areas where AI is positively contributing to video production: SCRIPTWRITING Photographer: Super Snapper | Source: Unsplash Quality scriptwriting is a crucial component of a compelling video. A well-written script will engage and impress your viewers, while a poorly written one can lead to indifference and disengagement. Crafting a script that successfully communicates your message to the right audience allows your video to resonate with viewers and drive action. In recent years, AI has become a fantastic resource for scriptwriting. Using AI in video production can help writers generate new ideas, revise old scripts, craft engaging stories, and even write complex dialogue. AI-powered scriptwriting tools also gather real-time data to help you: Pinpoint your target audience Analyze data from social media, news articles, apps, and other content Identify trends and topics that are relevant and popular Evaluate feedback and provide suggestions for improvement But don't forget about the importance of the human touch! Your audience will quickly recognize a flat AI-generated script, so add some warmth and authenticity to round the edges. Once you have your AI video script, pass it on to a real-life copywriter: They can add some personality and re-write phrases that don't quite make sense. A talented (and human) copywriter can do things AI just can't like: interpret intention and context, make emotional connections, and understand the subtlety and complexity of verbal and non-verbal language. VOICEOVERS A top-notch voiceover for your video creates a polished and professional final product. The voice must have an appropriate tone and style to match the intended message and audience. Scripts and voices should be carefully timed to the video. Producing a well-crafted voiceover ensures an engaging video with which your viewers can connect. Fortunately, AI in video production can quickly and easily create high-quality video voiceovers. Your businesses can save time and resources in the voice-over production process by using AI-powered text-to-speech (TTS) software, machine learning algorithms, and natural language processing (NLP). These tools also help create greater consistency and accuracy in the final product. Utilizing an AI-generated voice-over can do the following: Generate complete voiceovers in a matter of minutes (human voice recordings can take days or weeks) Customize various voices and accents to match any style of video content Adjust parameters such as pitch, volume, and speed to align perfectly with the video Maintain a natural tone, consistent pace, and accurate pronunciation throughout Artificial Intelligence can drastically improve your voiceover's overall quality and professionalism, leading to increased viewer engagement and retention. Just know that while it is an incredibly useful tool, AI isn't perfect. It can't understand flow or intention. Unlike live actors, it lacks the ability to make changes based on interpretation. And sometimes, the voice can sound a little like… well, like a robot imitating a human. TRANSCRIPTS AND SUBTITLES Producing high-quality video transcripts and subtitles ensures your content reaches the widest possible audience. In particular, you'll include viewers with hearing issues, language barriers, and those watching silently. Additionally, you can use this text to put your video content in written formats like blog posts and websites. It's essential, however, to maintain accuracy and clarity because errors can lead to confusion and misinterpretation of your message. AI in video production is a highly efficient way to auto-generate transcripts and subtitles for your videos. A few platforms have actually been using AI systems to transcribe for quite some time. You can accurately transcribe video content and quickly generate subtitles by leveraging deep learning AI algorithms and language processing technology like NLP. For example, AI can't transcribe audio elements that aren't voices, such as sound effects and music. And regarding accuracy, though AI is constantly improving, it's always wise to have a human being review your written content for any mistakes or misspellings. ANALYTICS Photographer: Carlos Muza | Source: Unsplash Analytics tools can provide valuable insights into how viewers engage with video content, including metrics such as view count, engagement rate, and audience retention. By analyzing these metrics, businesses can better understand what video elements are resonating with viewers and what may need to be adjusted. Your content will go further if you use analytics to guide your future video production and marketing strategies. With its ability to process and analyze vast amounts of data quickly and accurately, using AI in video production offers significant potential for improving video marketing analytics and enhancing the effectiveness of video marketing campaigns. One key way is through its ability to track viewer engagement. By analyzing viewer behavior, such as how long they watch a video or which parts they skip, AI can identify useful patterns and trends. Advanced AI analytic tools offer these capabilities: Segment and target audiences based on viewer demographics, interests, and preferences Determine areas of video content that need improvement Suggest changes to titles, keywords, and descriptions using click-through and conversion rates Predict the likely outcomes of video marketing strategies Overall, by leveraging AI capabilities and integrating them into your marketing strategies, you can gain valuable insights into your audience, optimize your video content, and achieve greater success in your marketing efforts. As you can see, AI in video production has the potential to become the ultimate tool in streamlining the video production process_._ But let's be honest; AI isn't a one-size-fits-all solution. AI falls short in some areas, especially those requiring a more nuanced and creative approach. The Limitations Of AI In Video Production: Why Human Input Still Matters Using AI automation for the tedious parts of video production, like transcribing, subtitling, and analytic tasks, frees up time and money for human video editors to focus on more creative and strategic aspects of video production. That's a good thing because AI can't compete with people when it comes to creating concepts and relaying emotions, storyboarding, and even serious editing. Let's look at a few more areas where AI hasn't quite caught up (yet). CREATIVE CONCEPTS While artificial Intelligence is a powerhouse for many aspects of video production, it currently lacks in the creative concept department. This is because the creative process of developing video content usually involves subjective, complex decisions that require human input and creativity. AI "brains" are a filing cabinet of existing facts and data that can be combined for helpful solutions and sometimes "new to us" ideas. Consequently, AI cannot replicate creative vision or intuition. AI can generate visual and audio elements based on predefined parameters. Still, it cannot replace the unique ideas and perspectives that come from human creativity and imagination. Furthermore, the creative conception of videos often involves collaboration and communication between different team members, including writers, designers, and directors. While using AI in video production can streamline certain aspects of this process, such as analyzing feedback data, it cannot replace the value of human collaboration and brainstorming. As a result, AI simply can't help much with the creative conception of videos. Thankfully, the artistic process will continue to rely on human creativity, intuition, and collaboration to develop unique and engaging video content that resonates with audiences. STORYBOARDING Humans may not always have the upper hand on AI, but regarding storyboarding, we definitely have them beat. That's because the storyboarding process involves creativity and intuition, and a profound comprehension of human emotion and motivation. Storyboarding involves visualizing and planning the narrative arc of a video, including the characters, scenes, and dialogue. This requires a deep understanding of the target audience, their preferences, and their emotional responses. While AI can generate insights and analyze data about audience behavior, it cannot replicate the emotional intellect that a human storyboard artist can bring to the table. Moreover, storyboarding often requires making creative decisions based on reasoning and personal perspective. A human storyboard artist can draw on their own experiences and imagination to develop unique and engaging visual elements that capture the essence of your story. AI in video production, on the other hand, can only generate visuals based on data sets, which limits the originality of the final product. Lastly, this process is often collaborative and involves lots of communication and cooperation. A storyboard artist can effectively express their feelings to other team members, developing a cohesive and compelling narrative. At the same time, AI in video production still lacks the ability to engage in thoughtful compromise. EDITING Editing videos involves piecing together the footage, adding music, sound effects, and transitions, and making cuts and adjustments to ensure the final product is exactly as it was envisioned. Good editing can make all the difference in the completed video, as it helps create a more cohesive and engaging narrative and can also enhance the visual and auditory aspects of the video. AI in video production and editing has come a long way. Newer AI capabilities, like quickly and seamlessly merging multiple clips, have eliminated countless hours of human editing and undoubtedly saved many budgets. And while AI is great at tackling basic tasks like motion tracking, color correction, and other technical processes, it has yet to advance enough to replace human editing completely. Skilled editors have a keen eye for detail and understand how to use their tools to create a visually and thematically impactful video that resonates with the target audience. AI only learns and operates within the parameters set by its programming and training data. This can result in videos that feel unoriginal, repetitive, and lacking in personality and human touch, which may not resonate well with the target audience.
